alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 2:32PM EDT until April 29 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff is lingering. * WHERE...Portions of southern Cherokee and Spartanburg counties in the South Carolina upstate. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows remain elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 228 PM EDT, River gages were continuing to show out of bank conditions across the Enoree, lower Tyger, lower Pacolet and Broad River basins. Overall, we are still expecting river levels to slowly fall across most places during the later half of the afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
